title: The Derek Chauvin Verdict: What We Know
sub_head: The former Minneapolis police officer was convicted on all three counts with which he was charged in the murder of George Floyd
body:
A Minnesota jury found former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, age 45, guilty on all three counts in the death of George Floyd, a Black man whose fatal arrest last year on May 25 was captured on video and set off a wave of protests calling for racial justice and changes to policing practices.
What did the jury decide?
The jury found Mr. Chauvin guilty on all three charges that he faced.
When is sentencing and what are the parameters?
Sentencing will happen in eight weeks. Mr. Chauvin faces up to 40 years in prison for second-degree unintentional murder, the most serious charge. Because Mr. Chauvin has no prior felonies, state sentencing guidelines recommend a range of around 11 to 15 years for his crimes, but prosecutors said they would seek a harsher sentence.
